description:
DIRECTOR, BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT (HIGHLY COMPENSATED)

LOCATION: REMOTE with +/- 25% travel

HIGHLIGHTS:

  • This is a HIGHLY COMPENSATED Sales Executive-level position. Base salary of over $100K. Year one total compensation potential over $200K, year two total compensation potential over $300K.
  • INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE IS REQUIRED! Candidates MUST have experience in Global Order Management, Origin Cargo Management, Third Party Logistics, International Transportation, or Supply Chain-related Software-As-A Service industry experience.
  • Position is REMOTE with some travel to clients/potential clients.
  • This is a NEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT/HUNTING position. Account Managers/Farmers need not apply.


GENERAL REQUIREMENTS:

This position requires the successful individual to aggressively pursue (Hunt) new business opportunities with new customers focusing on Global Order Management and associated Supply Chain solutions that we provide. Strong organization and communication skills are required. Previous experience developing new business in third party logistics, domestic, or international transportation is preferred.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES:

  • NEW CUSTOMER SALES/BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
  • Meet/exceed assigned volume and revenue goals by closing new business.
  • Actively target, seek out, cultivate, and establish new business for he assigned customers


and territory.

  • Maintain strong knowledge of potential customers in your area and business profile including current providers, business models, order management selection criteria, technology deployed and other opportunities.
  • Prioritize target accounts in terms fit with our suite of solutions and associated projected


revenue/volume opportunities.

  • Make clear, professional, and effective presentations to external customers moving the sales cycle forward.
  • Lead, organize and orchestrate internal resources around key opportunities that you developed including clearly articulating the opportunity at hand, customer stakeholder map, approach plan/strategy, competitive landscape and value proposition to close the business.
  • Lead, organize and orchestrate the company’s responses to requests for information and requests for proposal from prospective customers.
  • Strong administrative skills as it relates to daily/weekly logging of activity in Salesforce; effectively using Sales Navigator and Zoominfo tools.
  • Travel as required.
  • COMMERCIAL SERVICE COORDINATION
  • Maintain strong working relationships with product and technology groups to fully understand services.
  • Collaborate with other Hunt Team colleagues, Marketing and Pricing Teams as needed.
  • Seek opportunities to sell “End to End” Solutions to customers during your sales calls to potential or existing clients.
  • Support key industry events - TPM and RILA –maximizing customer meetings and building positive brand awareness
  • EXISTING ACCOUNT SALES/MAINTENANCE (IF APPLICABLE)
  • Meet/exceed assigned budget per account in your territory
  • Maintain a strong knowledge of your customers business operations, technologies and personnel to maintain and grow the business.
  • Liaise with each account’s Key Account Manager, customer service lead and technology resources with the goal of customer satisfaction.
  • Communicate timely customer updates to senior leadership as it relates to customer satisfaction, organization changes and other information that may impact ongoing business success.
  • Where applicable, monitor the progress of customer projects to ensure they are being produced and rolled out in line with agreed upon expectations.
  • Be a company Ambassador by always projecting a professional image for yourself and the company (both internally and externally).
  • Log all activity in Salesforce.
  • Travel as required.
  • PRODUCT AND MARKET KNOWLEDGE
  • Maintain strong knowledge of the company’s services, including origin operations, technology,


destination services. Understand how solutions have been deployed for existing customers.

  • Continually seek-out market, competitive and customer information from all available resources to best


perform your job and share with colleagues.

  • Suggest any networking opportunities such as local industry logistics conference and seminars.
  • ADMINISTRATIVE, ORGANIZATIONAL AND REPORTING SKILLS
  • Manages and prioritizes time and tasks effectively.
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, Word and Outlook
  • Prior experience with Salesforce, Sales Navigator and Zoominfo a plus
  • Effectively communicates with colleagues and prospective customers both orally and in writing
  • Ability to manage travel and costs in line with business development goals and the opportunities at hand and per company guidelines.
  • Manage timesheet requirements weekly and submit company expense reports no more than once per month.
  • Maintain current and target account lists for management (as requested).
  • Provide prompt, thorough, and accurate responses to all internal a
